name: Easy Thai Crispy Fish With Tamarind Sauce Recipe
description: Soft and tender fish flesh, covered in a sweet and spicy tamarind sauce with hints of garlic.

video.name: How to cook a Thai crispy fish www.hungryinthailand.com üêü #food #thaifood #thairecipe #fishrecipe #foodblog

recipeIngredient: a handful of chilies (fresh and dried, to taste)

itemListElement.text: Thoroughly clean the fish with cold water, both inside and out.
itemListElement.name: Thoroughly clean the fish with cold water, both inside and out.

itemListElement.text: Pat the fish dry completely to prevent oil splatter during frying.
itemListElement.name: Pat the fish dry completely to prevent oil splatter during frying.

itemListElement.text: Slice a few deep diagonal cuts across the flesh of the fish (not too deep).
itemListElement.name: Slice a few deep diagonal cuts across the flesh of the fish (not too deep).

itemListElement.text: Coat the fish evenly with cornflour.
itemListElement.name: Coat the fish evenly with cornflour.

itemListElement.text: Pour oil into a deep-frying pan, enough to submerge one side of the fish at a time, and heat it over a medium heat.
itemListElement.name: Pour oil into a deep-frying pan, enough to submerge one side of the fish at a time, and heat it over a medium heat.

itemListElement.text: When the oil reaches temperature, fry each side for approx 8 minutes until golden and crispy. Adjust frying time based on the fish‚Äôs size.
itemListElement.name: When the oil reaches temperature, fry each side for approx 8 minutes until golden and crispy. Adjust frying time based on the fish‚Äôs size.

itemListElement.text: After cooking, use a large spatula to carefully remove the fish from the oil and place it in a colander to drain any excess oil.
itemListElement.name: After cooking, use a large spatula to carefully remove the fish from the oil and place it in a colander to drain any excess oil.

itemListElement.text: Crush the chilies and garlic with a mortar and pestle.
itemListElement.name: Crush the chilies and garlic with a mortar and pestle.

itemListElement.text: In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together 1 tablespoon of cornflour with 2 tablespoons of water. This will be used later to thicken the sauce.
itemListElement.name: In a separate mixing bowl, whisk together 1 tablespoon of cornflour with 2 tablespoons of water. This will be used later to thicken the sauce.

itemListElement.text: Warm 3 tablespoons of oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saut√© the crushed chilies and garlic until golden and fragrant.
itemListElement.name: Warm 3 tablespoons of oil in a saucepan over medium heat. Saut√© the crushed chilies and garlic until golden and fragrant.

itemListElement.text: Add palm sugar, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and a splash of water.
itemListElement.name: Add palm sugar, tamarind paste, fish sauce, and a splash of water.

itemListElement.text: Stir in the cornflour mixture until the sauce thickens to a glossy consistency.
itemListElement.name: Stir in the cornflour mixture until the sauce thickens to a glossy consistency.

itemListElement.text: Transfer the fish to a serving dish and pour over the tamarind sauce. Top with fresh and dried chilies if you want to make it spicy.
itemListElement.name: Transfer the fish to a serving dish and pour over the tamarind sauce. Top with fresh and dried chilies if you want to make it spicy.

keywords: fish with tamarind sauce, thai crispy fish, thai fried fish
